Body:
Description: Hope this email finds you in good health.
 
I am writing this email to share an issue that we are encountering in EPP environment. We are not able to block upload over Cloud Drives. I request your help in resolving this issue. Note that all the other policies are working fine. It would be most appreciated if you could assign an engineer for a remote session with us. 

Thanks for your kind support. 

Regards,
Vikram Solanki

What We've Learned Updated: 2025.04.17:
In our remote session today we learned that the customer configured DPI Monitored URL Categories, this means that Endpoint Protector enforced the CAP Policy only on the domains included in the URL categories.  We informed the customer that because URL category was enabled the policy was not enforced on other domains.

Next Steps Updated: 2025.04.17:
The partner will do further testing with the end customer tomorrow and Monday.

We have scheduled a full hour follow up remote session for next week Tuesday, 22nd April at 4:30 PM IST.  The agenda of the call is to configure, test and discuss points regarding Content Aware Protection Polices and uses cases using URL Categories, DPI Allowed Domains, content uploads to cloud drive destinations.

Next Steps Updated: 2025.04.17:
The partner will do further testing with the end customer tomorrow and Monday.

We have scheduled a full hour follow up remote session for next week Tuesday, 22nd April at 4:30 PM IST.  The agenda of the call is to configure, test and discuss points regarding Content Aware Protection Polices and uses cases using URL Categories, DPI Allowed Domains, content uploads to cloud drive destinations.

2025.04.22 Update from Customer:

"I am writing to inform you that, as of now the policy is working fine in the environment and the challenge we are facing in the environment has been solved. As of now we are not facing any issue so we can proceed for the ticket closer. If the issue persists we will submit the ticket for support."
